channel.title: Tor Browser Not Launching
channel.description:
I'm getting this error when trying to launch Tor Browser:
Failed to run:
/home/user/.tb/tor-browser/Browser/start-tor-browser --allow-remote "file:///usr/share/homepage/whonix-welcome-page/whonix.html".
Exited with code: 2
I saw somewhere that I can probably redownload Tor Browser to fix the issue, but that this method would lose my bookmarks. Is there any way to save my bookmarks before I do this, or is there another way to fix the problem without redownloading the browser?
Thanks.

item.title: Tor Browser Not Launching
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
pointdrifter:

s there any way to save my bookmarks before I do this

Yes, sure. It’s a Firefox feature inherited by Tor Browser therefore also inherited by Whonix.

Just now documented here:
https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Tor_Browser/Advanced_Users#Backup_and_Restore

Documentation can be certainly followed by advanced users but it’s not novice user proof yet as it does not spell out instructions in a way that doesn’t require any complexity at all.

Read full topic

item.title: Tor Browser Not Launching
item.dc:creator: 0brand
item.description:
Hi pointdrifter

Could you please post the output from the following.

cd ~/.tb/tor-browser/Browser

./start-tor-browser --debug

You might be able to backup your bookmarks in the Tor Browser default.profile folder. I don’t use bookmarks in Tor Browser so I’m not sure.

~/.tb/tor-browser/Browser/TorBrowser/Data/Browser/profile.default/bookmarkbackups

Read full topic

item.title: Tor Browser Not Launching
item.dc:creator: pointdrifter
item.description:
I’m getting this error when trying to launch Tor Browser:

Failed to run:

/home/user/.tb/tor-browser/Browser/start-tor-browser --allow-remote "file:///usr/share/homepage/whonix-welcome-page/whonix.html".

Exited with code: 2

I saw somewhere that I can probably redownload Tor Browser to fix the issue, but that this method would lose my bookmarks. Is there any way to save my bookmarks before I do this, or is there another way to fix the problem without redownloading the browser?

Thanks.
